TopicTitle: Docked vessel, wont move anymore, even with engines running

Articles.Content:
Strange bug happens after I dock. I used a probe to dock with part of my planetary base that i want to lower onto the Mun.  The base had one kerbal in a laboratory on it. I made sure to select 'control from here' on the probe core, but when i turn on my engines, the craft doesn't move. I can turn the craft fine. I turned on cheats for infinite propellant and electricity to make sure, but the craft simply wont budge. When i undock from the craft the probe can move again, but then how am i supposed to move the base parts to the surface? Here is a screenshot, as you can see, the engines are turned on max, but there is no G-Force or movement taking place. I have K&K and mechjeb installed.

Any help would be appreciated.

Screenshot here

Edited February 18, 2018 by BattlejawGurnactica

21 hours ago, BattlejawGurnactica said:

Any help would be appreciated.

Your engines thrust is obstructed by docket vessel.This is like u blow into your own sail,while "mythbusters" prove that this would work,it wont in these game.

22 hours ago, sebi.zzr said:

Your engines thrust is obstructed by docket vessel.This is like u blow into your own sail,while "mythbusters" prove that this would work,it wont in these game.

Does this mean that i should extend the engines and make them go past the base part which I'm lifting? So that the engines don't blow directly onto the docked base part?

2 hours ago, BattlejawGurnactica said:

Does this mean that i should extend the engines and make them go past the base part which I'm lifting? So that the engines don't blow directly onto the docked base part?

Yes.

And welcome to the forums Battlejaw!
Fantastic, thanks Ten Key and sebi
